cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northwest, cross the northern Yucatán late Monday, then track north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near the New Orleans / Buras area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the United States as of this advisory (warnings confined to Yucatán and western Cuba)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in the United States as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with higher gusts are possible along the lower Mississippi River, including the Port of South Louisiana, especially Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge 3–5 ft above normally dry ground along southeast Louisiana tidal rivers and coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally higher totals possible, leading to flash-flood risk and operational slow-downs.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, river level rises on the Mississippi and connected waterways.
